events.title: Trial of Guy Fawkes Begins
events.description: Guy Fawkes and other conspirators accused of planning the Gunpowder Plot to blow up the English Parliament face trial in Westminster Hall.
events.significance: This event marked a pivotal moment in English history, reinforcing Protestant dominance and leading to stricter laws against Catholics.

events.title: U.S. House Passes 13th Amendment
events.description: The United States House of Representatives narrowly passes the 13th Amendment to the Constitution, which abolishes slavery in the U.S.
events.significance: This was a critical step in ending slavery in America and shaping civil rights development.

events.title: St. Valentine's Day Massacre Aftermath
events.description: In the wake of the St. Valentine's Day Massacre in Chicago, law enforcement intensifies efforts against organized crime networks.
events.significance: This marks increased national attention and crackdowns on organized crime during the Prohibition era in the U.S.

events.title: Launch of Explorer 1
events.description: The United States successfully launches its first satellite, Explorer 1, into orbit, marking its entry into the space race.
events.significance: Explorer 1's launch marked the beginning of U.S. space exploration, leading to important discoveries such as the Van Allen radiation belts.

events.title: Reunification of Germany Announced
events.description: East and West Germany announce plans to reunify, ending division post World War II.
events.significance: This event was a major milestone in European history, symbolizing the end of the Cold War and a move toward European unity.
